name: W New York - Downtown

reviews.text: This is a nice property for the most part. However, if I am to pay for a 4.5* hotel, I expect a bit more. The staff at recption was friendly and efficient. The rooms are well appointed but small. As I have a young child, I was annoyed that much of the shelf space in the room is taken up by the stuff for sale that was also within reach of my child. When I requested they be removed to afford more space in the room and less of an attractive nusiance, I was told there would be a $35 charge to do so. The room was mostly clean but a room needs to be FULLY clean. My child was playing on the floor and found a full vial of some type of single dose drug. When I brought it the front desk I was thanked for it. NOTHING FURTHER WAS DONE. Had I not seen my child pull up the mystery vial, I may have been taking a trip to the hospital. THIS REQUIRES MORE THAN A THANK YOU. Had the rooms been properly cleaned, I may have been more impressed with the rest of the place and less upset about the staff's inability to cope with a very upsetting customer experience but..... I might stay here again, but would never pay the standard rate as it is not worth the price. I question the current 4.5* rating. I stay in NYCa great number of nights each year and have had better experiences at a number of other less expensive alternatives. It is my hope that this review will serve to assist management with avoiding big problems in the future,
reviews.title: Paying for upscale but not REALLY getting it.

reviews.text: This property is beautiful - great views of the WTC site and a very stylish lobby. The lobby, while very cool, can feel a little crowded and loud.
reviews.title: Very modern and comfortable

reviews.text: The customer service is not attentive. When I arrived I stood at the desk for a while before anyone came over. I think the staff was watching a youtube video or looking at something on the internet - they were all crowded around one computer and didn't notice that I was standing there for a while. Also, I was overcharged on my hotel folio. I sent an email to the GM's email address as instructed on the folio, but I got no response.
reviews.title: Rooms are dirty
Exceed expectations!
reviews.text: I'm currently staying in the W Downtown (September 15, 2012). Here are some factual observations.

1. Upon check in: i) the sheets on the bed were stained, ii) one bath towel had someone else's hair all over it, iii) another bath towel was stained with a brownish substance, iv) the carpet by the door is stained with some white substance, and v) the cabinet door to the minbar is broken and half-hanging on by one hinge. This may be a relatively new hotel, but it doesn't seem like it.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: I stayed last Saturday for just one night. Check-in is on the 5th floor and I did check in at 11am with no problem. My preferred room was not available until 3pm so I took the room they gave me. It was very, very small. Smaller than NY hotels averages, if I was staying a few days I def. would have complained but I knew I was just using the room to shower/sleep. The elevators are a little slow and I was right in front of the WTC construction site and didn't hear anything. I do have one complain I did have to tell the housecleaning staff to keep the noise down, they were way to loud. The locale (and I am from here) is great, you have 3 subway lines with 10 min of each other that will get you anywhere. The morning "wake-up" coffee is a perk and the terrace on the 5th floor is something kind of nice to grab a beer and start your evenings. Overall, it was a nice stay but I think with all the spg options and the room size, you may be able to score a better deal. def. not worth it if you have to pay full price.The staff was great as well, one went out of their way at 5am to walk me to a store to p/u cold medicine, that was pretty cool.
reviews.title: Quick Overnight

reviews.text: have just returned from the most amazing trip to NYC - the location couldn't be better. A stones throw from the historic area and good bars/restaurants around South Street, a great place for a jog along the river early morning. Subway stations to head uptown are one block away, the hustle and bustle of the Financial District is on your doorstep and the fantastic shopping around Soho is well within walking distance. The staff really go out of their way to be courteous and helpful and treat guests with a warm respect. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. With regard to the construction going on around the World Trade Centre, it is fantastic to witness the regeneration of this area first hand - and you can't make an omelette without cracking eggs. It changes daily and it's really interesting to witness the development. It's New York - no one said it was quiet!
reviews.title: Perfect...

reviews.text: Generally really liked the W New York Downtown, with a couple tiny issues.
reviews.title: Stayed with kids and had a great time downtown!

reviews.text: As an SPG gold i wanted a view of ground zero, and they gave me a great spectacular room overlooking the grounds and a direct view of the new buildings. room was really nice and we especially liked the design and little details (kids loved the ocean sound machine for going to sleep, and DVD player is a necessity if you have kids since they don't have a 24-hour toddler channel ala PBS kids/ Nick Jr).
reviews.title: W - Downtown, great location and great hotel

reviews.text: the service in general was great, including a call to confirm all is well, bringing me a personal coffeemaker (but unlike Westin's and Sheraton's, this one had only medium starbucks, not the dark flavor we prefer and have gotten used to). they brought us free unlimited bottled water, and even came up with a bottle opener to open a beer for us (we bought it in a deli a few doors down for $2 instead of 6-7 in the minibar). They also allowed late checkout at 3pm (could have stayed til 4) the next day (SPGGold). That said, i didn't like that they didn't respect my free night (Best Rate Guarantee program) to allow me to have an SPG Gold amenity, but that could have just been some confusion.
reviews.title: Highly overrated

reviews.text: If you are visiting 9/11 memorial, this is a perfect hotel to stay in. The hotel faces the entrance to the memorial and be sure to sip at the lobby bar or even better, the outdoor balcony for a superb view of One WTC and the other upcoming WTC towers. Inspite of the the on going construction (which doesn't really bother me) the area is bustling with tourist and within minutes of Soho and lower east side. The WTC subway station is minutes away nearby century 21, or the Lexington line is a couple of blocks on broadway. The 5 th floor lobby is ideal and feels isolated from the main tourist traffic and 9/11 memorial crowd, unlike the other nearby hotels. The wonderful/spectacular rooms are fairly designed and seems normal with enclosed bathroom unlike some of the other Ws. We had a corner room facing south east. The service is just about average and somewhat 'cold' at the front desk, but that didn't really bother me since I'm not a high demanding guest and don't expect too much in terms of service and attention. However, some may find it to be rude and unattentive. At night, ther area tend to be on a quiet side after the memorial closes. Nevertheless, you could gawk at the brightly lighted 1WTC tower from the lobby bar balcony. The lobby has a good selection of costly drinks and nibbles. we we fortunate to have a package deal which offered complimentary drinks. Heading out to nearby soho is about a 15-20 min walk or a short subway ride. I give this 5* Just for the location and property but 4 * for the service. Would consider staying here again when in NYC. Note: if visiting the memorial , make sure to reserve free online tickets for designated time slot entry to the memorial.
reviews.title: WOW downtown NY location

reviews.text: Sometimes of the day, the front of the hotel is almost blocked by tourists visiting nearby attractions. When I arrive there was no way we can park and I had to be offloaded a block away. In the evening when I have to get a taxi it was impossible no cabs and the hotel not have a bellman service!!! My room was very dirty, battery capsuled on the phone was broken, bathroom not maintained. Turndown was very quick and they often missed things such as washcloths and bath amenities. Room service and bar/restaurant was sloppy. At breakfast they forgot to serve my tea and they wanted to charge me. Death banana fly in my white wine at lunch. Room service delivered still instead of sparkling water. My minibar in the room was not refilled during my stay and its was not refresh before my arrival. A lot of noise from the A/C installed on roof at neighbour building!
reviews.title: Many tourists in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I traveled to New York for our 20th wedding anniversary. What could have been a disaster [having to leave home 2 days early because of Hurricane Issac] was enhanced by the staff of this wonderful hotel. From the doorman, with great directions, to the upgrade to a corner room at check-in and the gift from the manager, everyone was sensational. After 5 days and 4 nights in NYC, 2 days at the US Tennis Open, 2 plays, we returned to Atlanta for our 7 1/2 hour drive home to a yard full of limbs and an empty refrigerator [no electricity for 4 days] and discovered that my wife had left her earrings in our room. Not to worry, they had been turned into security and were FEDX'd in response to her call.
reviews.title: 20TH ANNIVERSARY TRIP

reviews.text: Besides the incredible staff, the room was gorgeous, the view of the WTC site was excellent, the restaurant was tasty and we both loved our stay.
reviews.title: Very nice and clean hotel with good location

reviews.text: Stayed there in July 2011. The hotel is very good and clean. It was a little bit noisy since there's a construction at Ground Zero. Quite expensive, but you pay for the location, I guess. Room was very clean and nice and newly done, with a nice decor. Downstairs in a lobby there's always like a club atmosphere with music and people hanging out :). We stayed on 16th floor, did not hear any music, only some Ground Zero construction noise. I don't know how it is on lower floors.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A relatively new hotel directly across the street from WTC site. Several blocks from Wall Street and Battery Park. We stayed for 5 days and were thoroughly delighted by the location, staff and overall cleanliness of the place. Nicole ( Concierge) was great and very helpful in info and getting us passes to the WTC. Melanie ( front desk) could not have been more pleasant. Steve ( lobby) provided unsolicited mini-tour explanation of hotel and WTC history. Ray ( front lobby) does a spectacular job in shining and polishing and exhibits a super pride in his work and workplace. Zemina ( housekeeper) was excellent and took pride in her job.
reviews.title: Good location, great staff. Recommend.

reviews.text: Location is good for downtown and easy walk to all we wanted. Subway just a few feet away around the corner. Two blocks off Broadway and shopping close by. Several good deli's and a nice Asian / Sushi restaurant just around the corner. Will certainly return when in downtown NYC.
reviews.title: Good and Worth Checking Out
Very nice hotel
reviews.text: My first stay in downtown NYC after 20+ trips. Not an exciting location on the weekend but easy access to more interesting neighborhoods to the north. I suppose many travelers will be interested in the WTC location; I'm not one of them. The construction mess, security zone atmosphere and hordes of gawkers are not for me.

The hotel itself is nice. Room was stylish and modern but on the small side as is often the case with the W. Seemed larger than Lexington or Union Square properties, though. Good value in terms of rate.
reviews.title: coolness can be overrated

reviews.text: The onsite restaurant (BLT) is really good with very friendly staff. It's worth visiting. Front desk is polite and efficient. Only complaint re: staff is in Living Room bar. Extremely slow service with a definite attitude. Maybe it's all the WTC visitors milling about.
reviews.title: Great location, great style but not perfection.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last minute booking with a great fare and we had a wonderful evening. Arrived to be upgraded to a "spectacular room" overlooking the 9/11 Memorial site and the Freedom tower. The woman at check in couldn't have been nicer. We got two free drinks and an appetizer with our room rate, so off the the very cool bar we went before our evening activities. Our waitress was wonderful, drinks and food delicious, view amazing as the sun set and the lights of the city came up. Never mind that the entire hotel smells amazing. I could get picky about a few little things in the bathroom, but why bother - the view was awesome, the bed really comfortable and we didn't even know there was AC in the room - that's how quiet it was!!!!! I would stay here again when in downtown Manhattan in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: W - WOW!

reviews.text: From the great staff starting with Andrew at the front desk, to the great interior architecture, to the well appointed room, we had a wonderful time. Lots going on even on the weekend, which was a surprise. Easy public transportation options nearby. We will be back again soon.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the W Downtown

reviews.text: We arrived in the evening on the 9th of August. There were standing so many people in front of the hotel, red carpet, loud music... the security asked if he could help us with the luggages, but we were all fine. He managed us the way thru the crowd of people and we arrived at the beautiful reception on 5th floor... yes – the music was loud and we could barely hear what we were told, but it was fine.. and it was funny.. as it was a good atmosphere and no one was “pushing”. This was the only night in that week with loud music, the other days it was on a normal volume.
reviews.title: Very clean, friendly staff and big rooms for NY standards.

reviews.text: Then we arrived at the room, which was SPOTLESS! Congratulations for the housekeeping.. Everything was “in position” and I didn’t see one hair in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Overall Good Stay and Location

reviews.text: On the 5th floor you can go for free coffee in the morning! Nice idea!
reviews.title: Good, nice and clean hotel.

reviews.text: I stayed one night at the W in lower Manhattan while in town for business. I arrived in a raging rainstorm during an event at their restaurant after 7pm and had an easy, smooth check-in despite the hectic scene going on outside and within the hotel. MY SPG status was noted and I had reserved one of their corner rooms that overlooked the World Trade Center memorial. The room was very comfortable, a good size and the cushions in the large windows were great for sitting and catching the views (although it was rainy that night). The bathroom is very large, but the shower has a very soft water spray and it takes some time to completely soap off if you are used to a stronger shower head.
reviews.title: Great Location and room

reviews.text: Because I had such a long day and because of the storm, I did not go down to the lounge or balcony bar, but this appeared to be a lively and fun hotel and I could envision some good entertainment for happy hours and late night. I ordered room service for dinner and it is a bit pricey. The burger was cooked to order but the meat had been heavily salted for some reason; almost inedible. I had breakfast the next morning in BLT bar and grill; decent and filling but I noticed that my bill was double-charged at checkout, so I am contacting them to follow up on that.
reviews.title: Good for 2 - not more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely like to stay at this W again and take in more of its amenities, but it is very much the lower Manhattan neighborhood experience and there is a tourist crowd around going to the WTC memorial and other sites. There is also heavy construction in the area, but I did not notice any noise from my room.
reviews.title: Very chic hotel with great service; restaurant staff very slow during breakfast, though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My son, cousin and I made the trip to NYC for baseball, food and museums. This hotel is across the street from the Freedom Tower; an amazing sight. The property is geared toward a younger crowd than mine, and the boutique style of the rooms makes it difficult for more than two to comfortably sleep in a room.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the staff was quite good, the rooms clean and well-appointed, and the rate was not too bad. Location, as mentioned above, is first-rate.
reviews.title: Great place for a drink!

reviews.text: Had never stayed in this part of NYC before and it's definitely interesting to be somewhere new. This hotel is not my usual choice in the city but was chosen by a friend. I found it quite pretentious - it's hard to even find the entrance and you get the impression that this is deliberate. Once you do find it, you have to get into a lift just to reach reception which is hard when you are struggling with multiple bags. Check-in was an endless line with just 1 member of staff and you had to stand there while she gave the same instructions to each guest. Then, it's into another lift to get to your room.
reviews.title: Quite good

reviews.text: The room was pleasant enough - very white and sterile though which is not to my taste. A nice window seat which was comfortable and afforded a good view out over the 911 memorial. Bathroom is far too small and cramped with no storage space around the sink. You have to keep walking from bathroom to room to get your make-up etc. Very annoying.
reviews.title: Best stay in NYC

reviews.text: We ate lunch at the BLT grill at the hotel which had good food and pleasant staff. In all, it was OK as a place to stay if you like this sort of hotel but I would not rush to return here.
reviews.title: Overall Good Stay
Fantastic! Cool! Excellent
reviews.text: We stayed at the W Hotel for 2 nights in June, traveling with our small dog. Overall, the stay was magical! Unlike nearly every other visit to NYC, we were able to sleep soundly through the night with no outside noises. Our room (the Splendid with two queen beds) was so chic and extremely soundproofed. We were directly across the elevator but never once heard the elevator "ding" or people coming off or on. Nor did we hear any construction noise from Ground Zero.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bliss amenities were lovely and everything about the hotel was so cool and design-y. The mats in the elevator change based on the time of the day, the lighting is super cool and the lobby is very futuristic. Excellent service all around including lovely servers in the lounge. Super easy to travel uptown, to Central Park, Soho, etc. -- a line of cabs awaits outside the door and an easy walk to Battery Park.
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.text: My husband is a long-term guest at the W and I recently visited him for about a week. The service is top-notch (the Director of Sales called to check in on us-very nice), concierge is knowledgeable and, despite sitting directly adjacent to the new WTC site, the room was very quiet. If your travels require you to stay far downtown/Battery Park area, I recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Great Stay at the W

reviews.text: i love the location. Facing the beautiful big new WTC tower and peaceful 9/11 memorial pools. Room is comfortable and big enough.
reviews.title: nice stylish hotel

reviews.text: We stayed there for 3 nights in July and I must say that this is a fantastic hotel. Friendly and helpfull staff (service-minded), great location ( 9/11 Memorial park), a good choices of breakfast options nearby (the hotels own breakfast are over-priced) The only cons is that they charge you big money for internet in your room!
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel was great. The staff, the rooms, the location were all great. We would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.text: The W Hotel excels at providing cool, comfortable and stylish accommodations in a somewhat hectic area. Construction at the WTC site makes getting to and from the hotel somewhat challenging although most taxis have seemed to have figured it out pretty well. I did however find it a bit on the noisy side and out of the way to where I spent most of the time while in NYC. Perhaps next time, I will book at another location.
reviews.title: Cool, comfortable and stylish.

description: W New York – Downtown is where the Financial District power action is, rubbing shoulders with the Statue of Liberty, NYSE and Freedom Tower. Power wheel and deal at BLT, or be seen at our sleek and chic Living Room Bar & Terrace. With 217 rooms and 58 floors, explore the signature W bed, innovative technology, fantastic in-room entertainment and more, as Whatever/Whenever® makes all big city dreams come true.
